thing-type.label: FIBEFGS-213 FIBARO Single Relais Switch
thing-type.description: FIBARO Single Relais Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtFIBARO Switch 2 is designed to be installed in standard wall switch boxes or anywhere else where it is necessary to control electric devices. FIBARO Switch 2 allows to control connected devices either via the Z-Wave+ network or via a switch connected directly to it and is equipped with active power and energy consumption metering functionality.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtZ-Wave device learning mode, allowing to add the device to existing Z-Wave network.<br /&gtTo add the device to the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPlace the Switch 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtIdentify the S1 switch.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in (security/non-security) add mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times press the S1 switch.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the adding process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful adding will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtZ-Wave device learning mode, allowing to remove the device from existing Z-Wave network.<br /&gtTo remove the device from the Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtPlace the Switch 2 within the direct range of your Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtIdentify the S1 switch.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller in remove mode (see the controller’s manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, three times press the S1 switch.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the removing process to end.</li&gt <li&gtSuccessful removing will be confirmed by the Z-Wave controller’s message.</li&gt </ol&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Restore state after power failure
parameter.description: Restore state after power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines if the device will return to state prior to the power failure after power is restored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: First channel operating mode
parameter.description: First channel - operating mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating for the 1st channel controlled by the S1 switch.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: 1st ch. reaction to switch
parameter.description: First channel - reaction to switch for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device in timed mode reacts to pushing the switch connected to the S1 terminal.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set target state
no reaction to switch - mode runs until it ends
reset timer - start counting from the beginning

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes
parameter.description: First channel - time parameter for delay/auto ON/OFF modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 (0.1s), 1-32000 (1-32000s, 1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 50 (50s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: 1st ch. pulse time for flashing mode
parameter.description: First channel - pulse time for flashing mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time of switching to opposite state in flashing mode</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 1-32000 (0.1-3200.0s, 0.1s step) - time parameter</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 5 (0.5s)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Flashing alarm duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set duration of flashing alarm mode. (1-32000s duration, 1s step). The default value (600) represents 10 minutes.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_50_1
parameter.label: 50: Active power reports
parameter.description: Power level reporting threshold.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter defines the power level change that will result in a new power report being sent. The value is a percentage of the previous report. 0 disables the function.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_51_1
parameter.label: 51: Minimal time between power report
parameter.description: Determines minimal time between power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines minimum time that has to elapse before sending new power report to the main controller. 0 disables the function. 1-120s - report interval in seconds</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_53_2
parameter.label: 53: Energy reports
parameter.description: Energy level change resulting in sending a new energy report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtEnergy level change which will result in sending a new energy report. Available settings: 1-32000 (0.01 - 320 kWh). 0 disables the function.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_58_2
parameter.label: 58: Periodic power reports
parameter.description: Determines time interval for periodic power reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines in what time interval the periodic power reports are sent to the main controller. 0 - periodic reports are disabled, 1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_59_2
parameter.label: 59: Periodic energy reports
parameter.description: Determines time interval for periodic energy reports<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines in what time interval the periodic energy reports are sent to the main controller. 0 - periodic reports are disabled 1-32000 (1-32000s) - report interval</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_60_1

Results are be - ing added to energy reports for first endpoint. 0: Function deactivated 1: Function activated</p&gt</p&gt
